job_title: Registered Nurse in Santa Barbara, CA

job_title: Human Resources in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Ok/Good culture, good coworkers, beautiful facilities.
cons: - Really burns out their teams. You're expected to do the work of a fully staffed department even when severely understaffed with little to no incentives - Poor pay with expensive cost of living area. Yearly raises are only between 1-3%. This is with scoring 4/5 on your yearly performance review. - HR management and Executives make poor decisions and excuses in support of other bad managers/VPs - No real support from HR management or CHRO when working with difficult or outdated managers - Angry or unprofessional outbursts from both corporate and clinical managers are made to seem as normal by the HR team. - CHRO is not in touch with own team. She has her chosen few (mostly directors and managers) but if you are regular staff hardly checks in but you'll be sure to hear from her if any VP or manager makes the slightest negative remark. Her persona seems to be business over people, every time.

job_title: Medical Assistant in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros: The pay is competitive, similar to working at other large corps
cons: Like Dignity and so many other huge corps stifling the medical industry in San Luis, Cottage really doesn't care about patients. Anything beyond the most straightforward codes is just sent to the French or SV hospital. Depressing place to work if you're even a little compassionate.

review_title: What a great place to work!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Barbara, CA
pros:
There are so many.

Cottage treats their employees like they are worth something. The level of appreciation and recognition I receive on a daily basis is the highest I have ever gotten in my (almost) 40 year career. 

In addition, they pay at the high end of the scale, and the benefits are top-notch. 
When I applied, I asked for a 15% higher salary than I was getting from my former employer, and when Cottage extended me an offer, it was 15% yet again more than I asked for. That's unheard of in today's world. Their reasoning is that they "want to keep good people", and I would say that, between the higher than average salaries, better than average benefits, and extremely positive and rewarding environment, they have succeeded.

These factors motivate employees (myself included) to do our very best and give back to the environment and community. I intend to be here for a very long time.
cons: Hard to think of any, but I suppose every place has it's drawbacks. Cottage really tried to take feedback and make improvements any time the feedback is negative.

job_title: Case Manager in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Dedicated and caring coworkers, good benefits, used to be a great place to work.
cons: My first 8 years at Cottage Hospital were really incredible. I felt incredible pride to work for such an amazing organization. Sadly in the last 2.5 years management has become toxic, hostile and decisive. This shift for the worse has resulted in over 9 great clinicians leaving for other opportunities and they continue to lose amazing workers who simply cant tolerate this unhealthy environment.  I've never seen such unprofessional behavior by management and sadly from my experience I've found they have complete immunity to act as they please and they treat employees like dirt. It truly used to be a place where patients came first and now it's a place where managers bonuses come first. If you kiss butt you will survive but if you have any kind of opinion and disagree in any way you will have a target on your back.  I could have been a life long employee at Cottage but sadly had to get out early for my own health and happiness. They lead through bullying and intimidation.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: This is an amazing organization that really goes the extra step to engage staff.  As such, they are multiple winners of "Best Place to Work" and Fortunes "Great Place to Work"- top 20 in Healthcare. The company and leaders really live the mission and core values and make each person feel connected to the organizational values; a tough thing to accomplish with an organization this size. Opportunities are endless, if you put in the work, and the benefits/perks/compensation are "top notch." Leaving this organization was one of the toughest career moves I've ever had to make.  Just a note...they value "Diversity." Not sure what a previous comment from a different reviewer was as I, myself, am a "minority" and I've always appreciated how the organization supports a culture of diversity.
cons: None that I can think of.  Cost of living is out of control, but Cottage can't really do anything about that...they already offer above market pay.  They also offer housing purchase discount programs and community partnership to help lead the change in the community and also offer employee housing at far below market prices.

job_title: RN
pros:
Competitive salary - just enough over the median to make you stay and put up with the crud, politics, and inane work environment
Benefits - everyone raves about how good the benefits are but truth be told, I've had better. What they actually mean is that the benefits are above average in Santa Barbara, which is not saying much
cons:
Clock in clock out life for non-management - is a huge drag. Makes you feel like you're in prison because your minutes are being monitored
People - the non-professional employees are the most terrible bunch I have ever met. They are unprofessional (a lot of them will cuss and display completely inappropriate behavior that would get them fired if they didn't work here), extremely catty (so much dumb office drama, retaliation, silent treatment, tiffs), and most importantly, not that bright. A lot of them can't even do the simplest job right despite going through rigorous training. Any type of departmental change sends everyone into a tizzy. They are incoherent, irresponsible, and inflexible. They get away with all of this because management is terrible. Every day, I wonder at least once whether an employee brought their brain to work that day. It is hilariously unbelievable and makes for great happy hour conversation.

job_title: Concierge in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Pete's Coffee cart in Pueblo Lobby location, Great experience, Professional environment, co-workers can be fun. I know that if you are in other departments the experience here can be amazing.
cons: Pay is not that great, Health insurance is too expensive for employees in this department, Management can play favorites and not recognize employees who are stationed at other locations besides the Pueblo Lobby, Very strict policies on clocking in, inconstant shifts and hours, can be hard to meet managements expectations on our "Aggressively Friendly" environment in this department. Can not decorate for holidays or special events. Not much room to grow.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: I love(d) my co workers. They are dedicated, hard working, and a sheer pleasure to work with. Those people will be the next victims of the cons listed below.
cons:
Things went bad very quickly once new management came in. Everything changed, and the environment went from collaborative to divisive and hostile almost overnight. 
New management does not consider past performance at all. Everything that was done in the past to make the company better are disregarded, and if one mistake is made, you're out on your can.
Forewarning to current employees, watch your back, and for God's sake DON'T EVER MAKE A MISTAKE! If you do, you're done. Forget about any sort of second chance or consideration of any good things you may have done for the company. They simply won't count!

job_title: Registered Nurse in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: The manager really cares about the RN on this unit. She gets excited when her employees accomplish goals. She makes an effort to know everyone and always has a positive, encouraging attitude.The scheduling team works really hard to try to accommodate what everyone puts in for their schedule.  There is some really great teamwork on the night shift. Even on day shift people will try to help as best as they can, despite the craziness of days. Generally, the RNs here work well together.
cons:
Expensive area to live. I found more affordable housing that's a ~35 minute commute. Luckily I work night shift so I avoid the traffic. 
Lack of opportunity to work day shift. I've been here 2 years, still on the wait list for days for my unit. There's probably elsewhere in the hospital that has better day shift openings.

review_title: Cottage Hospital - Come for the benefits!
job_title: in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Benefits are important, and this business offers medical, dental, and vision benefits, in addition to a few more unusual benefits, such as partially subsidized seated chair massage sessions, gym memberships to use the equipment in the physical therapy department, and weight-loss group sessions.  There are occasional bus trips to see games of various sorts, or plays, in Los Angeles.
cons: As in all hospitals, there are many jobs where you are required to work nights or weekends, and holidays.  A hospital never closes.  There are some jobs though that don't require those types of shifts, and with seniority comes better options for shifts as well.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: It's a small hospital that has a lot of opportunities. Santa Barbara is one of the nicest places to live in California and the hospital has a great location in the midst of it all. Although the hospital is fairly small for the city, it is in the middle of making a large and expensive expansion. The neighborhood around the hospital is speckled with many specialists and physicians offices that continue to grow and expand, making SBCH a great learning hospital. It gives this little 6 story hospital a small town feeling, without the small town and with the perks of a larger hospital.
cons: Because Santa Barbara doesn't have other hospitals to compete with, its pay isn't equal to the cost of living in Santa Barbara. It also lacks unions, so pay is just mediocre for the area. It could be a great travel assignment though.

review_title: Quality patient care, terrible work environment. Unless you're into the whole "catty high school drama" scene.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Health professionals sincerely care about their patients and give outstanding care. Amazing benefits!
cons: MANY of the employees need a huge attitude check. An overwhelming amount of employees exhibit very negative, selfish, rude, and petty behavior on a day to day basis. Makes it harder to work in an environment that tends to already be stressful enough as it is. (High volume of patients, not enough staff, etc)

review_title: The most organized, professional and progressive  place I have ever worked
job_title: Emergency Room RN in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Collaborative environment, evidence based practices, shared governance. My co-workers are happy to be there and work as a team to improve our care. Excellent Dept. Manager who actually leads us on our journey towards excellence
cons: 1. High cost of meals in the cafeteria. 2. So many employees, it is sometimes hard to get to know other people on different units

job_title: Pct in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Everyone you work with is very professional. You know that all of the staff are qualified to do their jobs. Each department is like a team and family combined. I have never worked at a facility where calling in sick was a smooth process. They don't harass you or give you a hard time about it. Scheduling is pretty flexible and since most shifts are 12hrs, you only have to work 3 shifts a week to be full-time.
cons: not really a con, but in order to move up ranks, you need a degree or license. ex. cna to rn

job_title: Resistered Nurse in Santa Barbara, CA
pros:
Free Hospitalization and diagnostics is part of benefit package.
Wellness program rewards self care behaviors
Excellent pay for the region.
Clean pleasant work environment with state of the art equipment and free parking.
cons:
Lots of stand-by/call-back in PACU/Surgical services.
Administration is big on questionaires but we don't get comprehensive feedback on results.
Unit managers seem to be tied up in meetings all the time; don't always know their own employees that well..
Through-put problems sometimes leave patients stranded in the PACU for hours.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Outstanding executive leadership.  I never once felt like I was being asked to work harder so the top three people could line their pockets - the leadership is doing everything in their power to create a top notch hospital for patients, doctors and employees.  The benefits were outstanding.
cons: As with any large employer, some departments are more functional than others.  Administrative pay is a little low, although the benefits make up for it.

job_title: Nursing in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Good benefits.  Not the best, there are better in the private sector, but for this local community they were excellent.  Shared governance, meaning employees have some say in how things are run.  Much less tolerance of rude or prima donna MDs or managers than in the past.  Beautiful area to live in, lots to do outside of work and a nice community.  Great weather.  No snow!  Never!  Brand new facility completed in 2012.   Has generous reimbursement for continuing education, supports professional growth.  A good general hospital with excellent doctors. 99% of the doctors are really great to work with.   Lots of different floors, departments, so lots of opportunity to find which area is the right fit.  Has affiliated with university for advancement to BA & MA degrees onsite and by computer.
cons: Smallish town, no other hospitals to move to.  VERY expensive housing. One of the most expensive places to live in the country, unless you commute 90-180 miles/day (RT), which is also expensive with little public transportation. Management in general disconnected from employees and patients, seems to care more about appearances, prestige, and survey results than reality.  (Some departments are very good, others not, as far as management)  Parking difficult for employees and visitors. Hospital has large amount of "extra"capital, puts it into real estate and structural changes rather than employees and the community.  Seems to have delusions of grandeur, trying to compete with metro Los Angeles hospitals. Management very dollar-oriented, focus is on getting patients in and out as quickly as possible.  Employees get paid time off hours based on hours worked, so any sick time really comes out of what would be vacation and holidays in the private sector, meaning there is no extra allotment for sickness.  Quite a few non-professional employees are either rude or tend to ignore visitors and patients.  Very few women in upper management--the glass ceiling is alive and well.  Not much room for upward mobility.  Hires from outside more than from within for management.  Pay is quite a bit lower than in Los Angeles area 100 miles south, but cost of living is higher due to housing.  Working night shift is (or was) a requirement for new hire nurses,, which is very difficult/impossible for some people, and can be physically detrimental for those who don't tolerate it well.  (Most shifts are 12 hours).  Nursing shifts are cancelled for "low census" (as in most hospitals), but this is something that does not occur in any other professional work environment.

job_title: in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: I can't say enough good things about working here.  Unfortunately I relocated due to family needs.  Benefits were great.  Don't know if this is true now since insurance prices are so high, but when I was employed there my insurance was free and received free healthcare services within Cottage Health System.
cons: I really don't have many complaints about this job itself.  Santa Barbara is an expensive place to live so even with competitive wages it makes it difficult to make a permanent living here.

review_title: Cottage supports no feed back from employee
job_title: Register Nurse in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Nice place to live, Benefits are good.
cons: Mangement lack education and training to properly manage their employees. There is no positive feedback and yearly reviews are joke. Your manager does not meet with to give positive feedback and opportunity for growth, and to share negative feedback to make changes the enitre year.

job_title: Stationary Engineer in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Pay and benefits, lots of seemingly glowing reports from committees. Very bilingual - if you are fluent in English and Spanish you will go far.
cons: Easily verifiable danger signs: Relatives work in same office as management; relatives of contractors work for hospital; safety policies will satisfy a cursory look, but look deep - they are not thorough enough to be effective. Watch out for egos - management gets seasick when anyone rocks the boat.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Great Benefits, Wonderful people to work with, Staff members depending on the department really look out and care for each other.
cons: Management only cares about numbers and not how hard employees are actually working.  Employees are overworked and very unappreciated.  Very hard to be fired from especially management because directors just ignore the problems and make up initiative plans to help the manager without actually looking at the root cause.

job_title: Support Counselor in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros: Work-Home life balance, Employee Benefits, resources, pay, Human Resources, colleagues.
cons: hours can be cut due to low census, "department productivity" determines available hours to work. productivity is usually based off of patient census. Patient census being low doesn't equate to less work needing to be completed, So you're asked to complete the same amount of work in less available hours. Management.

review_title: I wish I could take back the 9 years of horror working here
job_title: Senior Department Assistant in Goleta, CA
pros: Scenery, weather, cheap medical insurance
cons: Unethical conduct within organization, underpaid, way overworked, various discrimination and harassment the entire time from HR, Finance, Purchasing and Employee Health and Safety. HR, Directors and management fail to protect injured workers to prevent further injury. Workload is increased for injured workers as a means to get them out. They allow horrible harassment to happen. If reported to HR, nothing is done and goof luck with advancing in the company. Company fails to protect class protected individuals from harassment and discrimination.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Great employees. Great Benefits. Fast paced work environment. Very focused on training and growing your skills. If you prove yourself as a good employee and finish nursing school, you'll likely have a job offer waiting for you upon licensing.
cons: If you don't live in SB, it is hard to bond with the other employees. Odd hours and inconsistent scheduling can take a toll on your personal life.  Techs do the dirty work, you definitely pay your dues.

review_title: Highly Unethical Crooked Company That Goes After Whistleblowers
job_title: Senior Department Assistant in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: The most beautiful city ever, Santa Barbara
cons: Management, Consistent abuse, cover ups of illegal activity in organization, goes after whisteblowers and once this has started there is little you can do to protect yourself. They destroy credible individuals!!!!

review_title: Not one of the best places to work (Modern Health Care)
job_title: Registered Nurse in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Organization is located in beautiful community
cons: This organization lacks integrity in the community. It uses its bullying persona to force agendas to command higher insurance reimbursements for sub-par care. Its continues to employee highly unqualified management staff and utilizes unethical human resources practices in dealing with employee/management  issues. Staff is very unhappy but afraid to voice their concern for fear of retaliation. Organization use Press Ganey for employee evaluations but fails to make changes to provide a better and safer workplace environment for staff.

job_title: Resource Nurse, MICU in Santa Barbara, CA

cons: Only ICU in town.  Epic documentation is always changing.  Hiring too many inexperienced new grads just because they worked in the unit as PCTs

review_title: I have loved every minute of working for this company, so much better than any corporation I have ever worked for.
job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Management listens to staff, it isnt run my money hungry CEO's who only care about their bottom line.
cons: Some senior staff think its okay to bully new staff, definite bullying culture.

job_title: Clinical Nurse II in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Cottage Health System is a great place to work.  Leadership really cares about both patients and employees.  Salaries and benefits are good.  Shared governance works well and it is easy to advance.  Nursing is very strong here.
cons: Access to nursing leadership is not quite as good as it used to be.

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: I was on temporary assignment so was not eligible for their benefits, but was told by the permanent employees I worked with that Cottage offers great benefits.
cons: Their timekeeping system is antiquated. I guess you need a formal punch-in/punch-out system for an organization this size. Also, half-hour lunches makes it hard to go off-site.

review_title: Friendly and healthy environment and culture
job_title: Registered Nurse in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Company cares about employees and listens to concerns and ideas. Healthy food options, excellent customer service. CEO is very approachable and friendly.  Employees are generally happy and satisfied.
cons: Cost of living is high in area which pay doesn't seem to match.  In other areas more north the pay is considerably higher.

review_title: Very poor management, lack of support
job_title: Registered Nurse in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Benefits are stated to be good (as with all hospitals of working professionals) as well as location.
cons: Poor management tactics, lateral violence is accepted, bullying tactics are used to retaliate against nurses who speak up about the system by management. Rock the boat and they will throw up on you.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: I appreciated the people I worked for and our floor manager.  I loved the location.
cons: The field of work as a PCT/CNA is low paying for the emotional and physical demand the job requires.  There is a huge pay discrepancy in the medical field.

job_title: Pct in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Very good team builder. Nice benefits...
cons: It takes a long time for promotion...

job_title: Registered Nurse in Santa Barbara, CA

review_title: Quality healthcare system aimed at being the best in patient satisfaction.

State of the art OR Suites & equipment.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Santa Barbara, CA

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Santa Barbara, CA

cons: Poor management. No autonomy.   Do not have therapy driven protocols.  Not very progressive.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Employees are proud to say they work here.
cons: Growing larger and getting more "corporate" in some of their policies.

job_title: Pct in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Great Environment to work, friendly, supportive, great chance of advancement. Generous in CE.
cons: I was happy there and sadly I had to move. I would recommend this company to everyone.

job_title: in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: The benefits are great, the people that work there are friendly and a fun bunch.

pros:

Opportunities for growth.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: Great benefits, good management, policies actually backed up by the literature.
